Package org.xlattice.corexml.bind

This is a Java data binding facility.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AttrBag
    Maintains an unordered set of AttrBindings.
    AttrBinding
    Bind an attribute value in XML to the value of the named field in the associated class.
    Bag
    Maintains an unordered set of Joins (bindings, submappings, etc).
    Binding
    Superclass for Joins that bind XML element or attribute values to fields in Java objects.
    Collector
    Bind a set or list of Joins under a single tag without creating a Java object.
    EmptyElBinding
    Bind a subelement's presence in XML to the value of the named field in the associated class.
    Interface
    On the XML side, allow any of a set of SubMappings to appear.
    Join
    Superclass of mappings between XML nodes and Java classes.
    Mapping
    Data structure describing the binding between an XML tree (Document or Element) and a set of objects.
    NameGenerator
    Generate standard method names from the base field name.
    Ordering
    The set or sequence of Joins which bind XML element or attribute values with fields in an object which is an instance of a bound class.
    Seq
    Represents a set of bindings (Joins) to be applied in serial order (in sequence).
    SubElBinding
    Bind a subelement value in XML to the value of the named field in the associated class.
    SubMapping
    Create a mapping from an XML subelement into a Java class.
    TextBinding
    Bind a text value in an XML element to the value of the named field in the associated class.

Package org.xlattice.corexml.bind Description

This is a Java data binding facility.

XML documents are bound to instances of Java classes by writing what amounts to a description of the binding in terms of a number of classes:

  • a Mapping, which relates the top-level XML element to the topmost Java class instance
  • SubMappings, used where a subelement maps into a child object
  • Bindings, which relate XML values to values of fields in objects:
    • AttrBindings, connecting attributes to fields
    • EmptyElBindings, which set a boolean to true if a subelement is present
    • SubElBindings, which connect the value of a subelement to a field value, and
    • TextBindings, relating the text within a subelement to a String field in the corresponding object
  • Collectors, signalling the presence of a element in the XML which does not cause the creation of a Java object on input
  • Interfaces, where a set of submappings map into a set of classes implementing the same Java interface
The constituents may either be optional or allowed to repeat.

Additional descriptor classes will be added after more experience with the package in its current form. We also intend to add a facility for generating the mapping from an XML description.
